geninfo.para: If a complaint of unsatisfactory air conditioning cooling is received on a 2000, 8000, 9600 or 9700 Model with a Cummins M11 engine, the condition may exist because the heater hoses are reversed at the engine. Check to be sure the heater hoses are not reversed at the engine. If the hoses are reversed, hot water will flow through the heater core all the time, greatly affecting air conditioning performance. For proper operation of the heater system, the 3/4 inch hose should be on the outside fitting (2000, 8000) or valve (9600, 9700) and the 5/8 inch hose on the inside fitting (2000, 8000) or valve (9600, 9700) as illustrated in Figure 1.

figure.caption: Figure 1. Correct Installation Of Heater Hoses

geninfo.para: If after inspection the hoses are found reversed, lower the cooling system coolant level and reverse the hoses and fittings on 1000 and 8000 Models, and the hoses and shut off valves on 9600 and 9700 Models.
Re-install coolant, run engine and check for leaks
